content.question: Substance Specific Heat<math alttext="(in joules per gram degree Celsius)" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mo>/</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mo>·</mo><mo>°</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> Water <math alttext="4.18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.75em"></mspace><mn>4.18</mn></math> Ethanol <math alttext="2.44" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.75em"></mspace><mn>2.44</mn></math> <math alttext="F e, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Fe</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> <math alttext="0.449" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="1.05em"></mspace><mn>0.449</mn></math> Two identical insulated containers hold equal masses of liquid at the same temperature; one contains water and the other contains ethanol. Two identical cubes of <math alttext="F e, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Fe</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> are heated to the same temperature, one cube is placed in each container, and both systems are allowed to reach thermal equilibrium. Based on the information in the table shown, which of the following best predicts what will be observed?

choices.label: Both systems will have the same final temperature because the mass and initial temperature of the liquids are the same.

Both systems will have the same final temperature because the <math alttext="F e, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Fe</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> cubes will transfer the same amount of heat to both liquids.
The ethanol system will have the higher final temperature because the specific heat of ethanol is lower than that of water.
The ethanol system will have the lower final temperature because the specific heat of ethanol is lower than that of water.

content.answer: The ethanol system will have the higher final temperature because the specific heat of ethanol is lower than that of water.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
